title: Innovative Mental Health Nursing Pedagogy: Short-Term Intensive Course Based on Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of foundational nursing knowledge and introduction to psychiatric/mental health nursing
context.additional_context: Need to apply blended learning models to enhance effective psychiatric nursing competencies in non-face-to-face education post-COVID-19. Requirement for instructional design combining role-play, case studies, and flipped learning in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners perform assessment and intervention techniques for five major psychiatric symptoms (auditory hallucinations, delusions, depression, etc.) with over 80% accuracy in mental health nursing contexts
Over 90% of learners can propose case resolutions by applying mental health nursing theories (therapeutic communication, crisis intervention, etc.) to actual clinical cases
Learners complete 100% of collaborative assignments with peers using digital platforms (LMS, video conferencing tools) in blended learning environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
